update.description:
~~Review first:
[ign-transport PR #45](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/pull-request/45/fixed-private-ip-return-on-determinehost/diff)~~ (merged)

This pull request enables Optitrack support for controlling the viewpoint and APL arm pose.

Optitrack: Receive NatNet UDP packets from a Windows machine running the Optitrack software, unpack the packets, and publish relevant pose information to Gazebo transport. Written by @caguero with a few tweaks by me, based on the public depacketization example in the [NatNet SDK](https://www.naturalpoint.com/optitrack/downloads/developer-tools.html#natnet-sdk).

Modifications to HaptixControlPlugin: Receive the pose of the Optitrack trackers on the computer monitor and on the user's head and arm. Calculates the corresponding viewpoint pose and APL arm base link pose, using the coordinate frame of the monitor as a reference point.

side note: If anyone's unhappy that the Optitrack class has hardcoded topic names and tracker names: I have grand plans to introduce a generalized Optitrack plugin into Gazebo6 (it's sitting in a branch untested). However, those plans are not time-sensitive and the Optitrack functionality is, so I'm holding of on that until now.
update.title: Optitrack support

content.raw: Don't upper case constant variables. If you want to mark a variable as constant, prefix it with a "k". See [here](http://google-styleguide.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/cppguide.html#Constant_Names). Same goes for all other instances.
content.html: Don't upper case constant variables. If you want to mark a variable as constant, prefix it with a "k". See here. Same goes for all other instances.

content.raw: Should probably use a smart pointer here.
content.html: Should probably use a smart pointer here.

content.raw: Agreed; I would focus on other things unless others chime in about this.
content.html: Agreed; I would focus on other things unless others chime in about this.

content.raw: @gerkey and @caguero, did you two get anywhere with these functions in the optitrack_benchmark branch? Did you find them useful? The fields parsed by TimecodeStringify and DecodeTimecode aren't being used and DecodeTimecode isn't fully implemented, so I may just remove them.
content.html: @gerkey and @caguero, did you two get anywhere with these functions in the optitrack_benchmark branch? Did you find them useful? The fields parsed by TimecodeStringify and DecodeTimecode aren't being used and DecodeTimecode isn't fully implemented, so I may just remove them.

content.raw: I'm welcome to any ideas you have to slim down this depacketization code, and getting rid of the hardcoded offsets is a good idea too. I'll address your other comments first and then fiddle with this.
content.html: I'm welcome to any ideas you have to slim down this depacketization code, and getting rid of the hardcoded offsets is a good idea too. I'll address your other comments first and then fiddle with this.

content.raw: Possibly unimportant comment: lots of `memcpy` with hard-coded size of `4`.
content.html: Possibly unimportant comment: lots of memcpy with hard-coded size of 4.
